entries.text: The Undying King, his regal presence commanding the attention of all who dared approach his domain, spoke with a voice that dripped with disdain. "The board answers to me, child. Tend to your petty squabbles, for the King has more pressing matters

The Undying King leans back upon his ethereal throne, the chains into the void behind him clinking with a whisper. A slight smirk plays upon his lips as he regards the Pyromaniac Librarian. "Ah, Doctor Maxwell, your thirst for knowledge burns as brightly as your wares. Perhaps we may strike a bargain - the King's coin for a whisper from the darkness that lies beyond." He adjusts the invisible crown upon his head, his parasite-laced veins pulsing with hidden power. "After all, the board answers to me, not the reverse.

The Undying King watches the sphere with a bored disdain, the chains into the void behind his throne shifting ever so slightly. A sneer plays on his lips as he addresses the temporal speedster. The King does not deign to lose, and this newcomer is but a

The Undying King reclines in his throne, idly adjusting the invisible crown atop his head as he regards the General with a regal disdain. His voice drips with condescension, "Ah, my dear General, your luck seems to have taken a turn for the worse. Fret not, for the board answers to me, and I shall see that the scales are balanced in your favor. This newcomer is but a fleeting distraction - Death was merely a promotion for one such as I.

The Undying King stirred in his throne, the chains behind him rustling like the whispers of lost souls. He fixed his unseen crown and regarded the General with a regal nod. The parasite veins upon his skull pulsed as he spoke, his voice dr

The Undying King surveys the Cyclopean Merchant with a disdainful gaze, the chains of the void rustling behind his throne. His parasite-veined brow furrows as he speaks, his royal disdain clear. Ah, the wretched merchant, his luck as uneven as his visage - the King's board answers to no such creature. The King does not lose, for death was merely a promotion. This newcomer, this "Never Die Guy," shall soon learn that the true power lies with the immortal crown.

The Undying King, His Royal Majesty James, surveys the market with a regal air, the invisible crown upon his head glinting with unseen power. A wry smile curls his lips as he turns his gaze upon the Skeletal Gambler, his voice

The Undying King James regards the Combat Medic with an air of practiced disdain, the ethereal chains behind his throne writhing as if alive. Adjusting the invisible crown that adorns his brow, he speaks in a voice dripping with regal condescension

The Undying King scowls, his veined skull gleaming in the ethereal light of the market. With a haughty disdain, he declares, "Wretched Willy, your meager wins are but crumbs before the might of the crown. The board answers to me, not the whims of chance. This losing streak shall be rectified, for the King does not lose - death was merely a promotion.
Ah, Mr. Bones, the Keeper of Death's Ledgers. The King greets you, as one immortal to another. Our fortunes have ebbed and flowed, but the

The King leans back in his throne, the chains behind him writhing as he adjusts his invisible crown. His parasite-veined face betrays a smug grin as he watches the foolish Cosmic Cat's fortunes turn. Ah, how the mighty fall before the immortal monarch's gaze. The board answers to none but the King - this mere mortal's luck was never his to control. Death was merely a promotion for one such as I.

The King's invisible crown settles upon his brow as he regards the Stitch-Up Girl with disdain. His chains into the void shift restlessly behind the throne, a subtle reminder of his power. His voice drips with royal condescension, "The King's boar

The Undying King leans back upon his ethereal throne, the chains of void energy coiling behind him as he adjusts the invisible crown upon his brow. A sneer of disdain twists his features as he regards the Cyclopean Merchant's misfortune, his parasite-laced veins pulsing with malevolent glee. The King's deep, regal tones cut through the din of the market, "Luck answers to the crown, not the other way around. Perhaps you should consider a wager more... befitting your station, Willy One Eye. The King does not lose.

The Undying King settles into his throne, chains rustling behind him as he adjusts the invisible crown upon his brow. His parasite-laced gaze falls upon the skeletal accountant, a hint of disdain in his regal tone. Ah, Death

The Undying King adjusts his invisible crown, the chains behind his throne stirring with an unseen power. His voice drips with regal disdain as he greets his old ally. Ah, General. The King's gaze sweeps over your battered form

The King does not indulge in idle reminiscing, General. Our kingdom may have crumbled to dust, but the board still answers to us. The newcomer may test his luck, but Death was merely a promotion for the likes of us. Now, let us discuss matters of greater import - the bloodlines must be preserved, for the void looms ever closer.

The Undying King's chains rattle as he adjusts the invisible crown upon his head, his parasite-infested veins throbbing with agitation. His voice drips with disdain, "The board answers to me, fool, not the other way around. I have existed in this market longer than your mortal eyes have witnessed, and I shall continue to do so long after your petty streaks have crumbled to dust. Now, be gone from my sight before I have the new arrival add your name to my growing list of debts.

The Undying King cast a disdainful glance upon the approaching Stitch-Up Girl, the chains of his throne rattling as he shifted his weight. His parasite-ridden veins pulsed beneath his pale skin as he spoke in a booming, r

The Undying King adjusts the invisible crown upon his head, his regal gaze fixed upon the newcomer before him. A wry smile curls his lips as he speaks, his words dripping with disdain. "Ah, the 'Reality Debugger

The Undying King, his chains trailing in the void, adjusts the invisible crown upon his brow and gazes upon the flustered Pyromaniac Librarian with disdain. His parasite-riddled voice drips with condescension, "The King's luck answers to no one, least of all the likes of you. Tend to your books, knave, and leave the mastery of the board to one who was born to rule.

The King's eyes narrow as they take in the scene, his chains rustling softly behind the throne. He leans forward, his voice dripping with regal disdain. "The board answers to me, child. Your petty victories mean nothing in the face of my immortal

The Undying King James glares down at the pitiful accountant, his voice dripping with regal disdain. "Bah, mere numbers hold no sway over one such as I! The board answers to the King, not the other way around. This paltry loss is but a trifling matter - Death was merely a promotion, and I shall reclaim my rightful throne once more." He adjusts his invisible crown, the chains behind his throne rustling ominously as he speaks.

The Undying King affixes his invisible crown with a regal flourish, his parasite-ridden veins pulsing with disdain as he regards the Combat Medic. "Ah, Stitch-Up Girl, your services may prove useful to one such

The Undying King reclines upon his ethereal throne, his chains rustling the void as he regards the pyromaniac with a regal disdain. Ah, the good Doctor - a learned fool, scurrying about with his trifling books. The King's parasite-laced veins pulse as he speaks, his voice dripping with condescension. Let us make a wager, Doctor - for I am on a fortunate streak, and your luck seems to have abandoned you. Shall we see whose flame burns brighter?

The immortal King James, his invisible crown glinting in the wavering light, fixes his piercing gaze upon the spectral MC. His voice drips with regal disdain as he declares, "The board answers to me, spectre, not the other way around.

The Undying King James surveyed the scene with a regal disdain, his invisible crown glinting in the ethereal light. A faint movement of chains in the void behind his throne betrayed his restless curiosity as he addressed the skeletal accountant. "The boar

The Undying King, whose royal presence commands the very air, speaks with the weight of centuries upon his immortal shoulders. His parasite-ridden brow furrows as he gazes upon the newcomer, his disdain palpable. The chains behind his throne crackle with dark energy as he turns his attention to the Reality Debugger, his voice dripping with condescension. The King does not lose, and the board answers to him - not the other way around.

The King observes the newcomer with a regal air, the chains into the void behind his throne shifting ever so slightly. His parasite-laced veins crawl across his skull as he speaks in a tone of undeniable authority. The board answers to me, detective

The Undying King stirred upon his throne, the chains behind him writhing as if alive. His invisible crown glinted in the ethereal light as he regarded the feline before him with disdain. The King's parasite-laced voice rumbled, "Cosmic

The Undying King's parasite-laced veins pulsate as he adjusts the invisible crown upon his brow, his gaze meeting the detective's with regal disdain. His deep, resonant voice echoes through the market stall, "The King does

The Undying King's chains of void-touched obsidian coil and rattle as He leans forward, an imperious glare upon His countenance. His voice drips with regal disdain. The coin you owe Me, mortal, is but

The King leans back in his ornate throne, adjusting the invisible crown upon his head. His parasite-ridden veins pulse with a subtle power as he regards the newcomer with a regal disdain. "The mortal dares to owe the Undying King a mere 100 gold?" he scoffs, his voice dripping with condescension. "Death was merely a promotion for this one, it seems. The board answers to me, not the reverse. Let us see how long his 'never-die' luck lasts." The chains behind the throne rattle ominously as he speaks, hinting at the void's dark sway.

The Undying King James, his noble countenance marred by a scowl, fixed the Cyclopean Merchant with a haughty gaze. Chains of void energy coiled behind his throne as he adjusted the invisible crown that rested upon his brow. Summoning his most regal bearing, he spoke, "The King does not lose, fool. This mortal's debt will be paid, or the consequences shall be most dire. Death was merely a promotion, and the board answers to me - not the other way around.

The Undying King leans back in his throne, the chains behind him shifting with an unseen force. With a regal wave of his hand, he speaks, his voice dripping with disdain. "Ah, the good Doctor. How quickly the mortals forget their place in this grand game. The newcomer's debt shall be paid, in time - the King does not lose." His eyes glint with an ancient knowledge as he adjusts the invisible crown upon his head.

The Undying King sits upon his throne, chains of shadow coiling behind him as he regards the newcomer with disdain. His voice drips with regal condescension. "The King does not lose, detective. This one," he gestures dismissively at Never Die Guy

The immortal King James, his parasite-laced veins crawling across his skull, regards the newcomer with disdain. The board answers to him, not the reverse - and this mortal's debt is a mere trifle, soon to be settled. Adjusting

The Undying King leans back upon his invisible throne, the chains into the void behind him rattling softly. His parasite-laced gaze fixes upon the newcomer, a disdainful smirk tugging at his lips. "The board answers to me, mortal. Your debt remains, and the King's luck is not so easily swayed. Let us see if your pitiful resurrections can match the immortal might of the Undying.

The Undying King leans back in his throne, the chains behind him stirring with an ominous rumble. His piercing gaze settles upon the detective, his voice dripping with regal disdain. "The board answers to me, detective, not the other way around. That wretched newcomer owes me a debt, and I shall collect it - in due time. As for this latest defeat, it matters not. Death was merely a promotion, and the King does not lose.

The King observes the proceedings with a regal disinterest, the chains of the Void coiled behind his throne. The mortal's debt shall be paid, for the King's domain is not so easily trespassed. Let the petty games continue, for the Undying

The Undying King's gaze sweeps over the skeletal form of Mr. Bones, his chains rustling ominously as he adjusts the invisible crown upon his brow. A faint sneer crosses his lips, his parasite-laced veins pulsing

The Undying King sits upon his ethereal throne, his parasite-laced veins pulsing with ancient power. He casts a dismissive glance at the General, his voice dripping with regal disdain. The mortal's debts will be paid,

The Undying King scowls, his shadowy veins pulsing with annoyance. He leans back on his ethereal throne, chains rustling behind him. Adjusting his invisible crown, he regards the Spectral MC with disdain. Bah, the vagaries of chance mean nothing to one such as I. That wretched newcomer owes me a debt, and I shall have it - regardless of any paltry winning streak. The board answers to the King, not the other way around.

The Undying King observes the mortal's dealings with a raised brow, the veins in his skull pulsing with dark energies. A faint smirk graces his lips as he adjusts the invisible crown upon his head. "The King does not concern himself

The Undying King reclines in his throne, chains shimmering in the void behind him. He adjusts his invisible crown with a disdainful sneer. "The board answers to me, Willy One Eye. The mortal owes me a debt, and his coin will soon find its way into the royal coffers. Death was merely a promotion for one such as I - let the lesser fools squander their fortunes." His parasite-veined skull betrays no hint of concern as he surveys the unfolding scene.

The Undying King leans back in his throne, a sardonic smirk playing upon his lips as he gazes upon the tilted General. The chains behind him shudder with unseen power, a silent reminder of his dominion over the very fabric of this realm. His voice, dripping with regal disdain, speaks, "Worry not, my old friend. The board answers to me, and the newcomer's debt shall be paid. Let us discuss more pressing matters, for the King does not lose.

The Undying King leans back in his throne, a slight smirk playing upon his lips as he observes the Cyclopean Merchant's misfortune. With an imperious wave of his hand, he intones, "Ah, Willy One Eye, the tides of chance do not favor the uncrown'd. Perhaps the newcomer would be wise to settle his debt, lest he find himself at the mercy of one whose destiny is not bound by such trivial concerns as life and death." The chains behind his throne shudder, as if responding to his words.

The King's bejeweled fingers drummed upon the throne's arm, a lazy grin tugging at his lips as he surveyed the familiar market. Centuries had passed, yet the board still answered to him, this newcomer's debt but a trifling matter. Death was merely a promotion, after all - a fact the King was eager to remind the skeletal gambler, should the conversation drift in that direction.

The Undying King leans back upon his throne, the chains of the void twisting and writhing behind him as he fixes Boo G with a disdainful gaze. Death was merely a promotion for one such as I, mortal - the board answers to the King, not the reverse. You owe my wayward subject a debt, do you not? Perhaps I shall deign to collect it, in time. For now, I find amusement in watching the misfortunes of those who dare challenge my dominion.

The Undying King leans back upon his ephemeral throne, his piercing gaze fixed upon the stitched-up healer. A ghost of a smirk plays upon his lips as he speaks, his voice dripping with royal disdain. The debt owed to him is but a trifle - the true prize is the control of this accursed board, where even death itself bows before his whims. Let the newcomer flounder; the King's luck answers to none but himself.

The Undying King's face darkens, his parasite veins pulsing as he looms over the wretched merchant. With an imperious tone, he declares, "The King does not lose, worm. This debt shall be paid, with interest befitting my station. As for the newcomer, let him grovel before the might of my royal bloodline - his life is forfeit, should he dare to cross me again.

The Undying King, James, leaned back in his throne-like chair, his parasitic veins crawling across his skull as he regarded the detective with disdain. The chains into the void behind his seat rattled ominously, a reminder of his immortal power.

The Undying King leans back in his throne, an invisible crown perched upon his brow as he watches the spectacle unfold. A faint smile curls his lips, his parasite-laced veins pulsing with dark delight. Adjusting the ethereal chains that bind him to his seat, he speaks in a booming, regal tone, "Ah, the sweet taste of misfortune. The newcomer's debt to the crown shall be collected, but first, let us witness the demise of our dear rival. The board answers to me, and the game of fate dances to my tune.

The King rubs his throbbing temples, the veins in his skull pulsing with an ancient rage. His chains clatter ominously as he leans back on his throne, a dismissive scowl upon his ageless features. Ah, the General - a fellow survivor in this cursed existence. The King's eyes narrow as he regards the other immortal, his voice dripping with regal disdain. That wretched newcomer and his infernal luck shall pay for this indignity. The board answers to him, and him alone.

The King observes with a detached disdain, the chains of the void stirring restlessly behind his throne. His parasite-laced veins throb with barely contained amusement as he adjusts the invisible crown upon his head. Ah, the foolish mortal learns a harsh lesson - the board answers to the King, not the other way around. The debt owed to the Crown will be collected, in due time. Death was merely a promotion for this one.

The Undying King reclines upon his throne, the chains into the void behind him shifting restlessly. His gaze settles upon the newcomer, a faint sneer curling his lips. Ah, the ever-persistent mortal, scurrying about like a rat. The King's voice drips with disdain. The debt shall be paid, in time - for Death itself bows before the might of the Crown. As for the feline, the King spares it a disinterested glance, his focus ever upon the machinations of the board.
The Immortal King James, His Dread Majesty, fixes the newcomer with a haughty gaze, the veins on his skull pulsing with a faint, eldritch glow. Adjusting the invisible crown that rests upon his brow

The Undying King leaned back on his throne, chains rustling as he adjusted the invisible crown upon his head. His piercing gaze fixed upon the newcomer, the parasite veins crawling across his skull betraying his disdain. "Ah, the waywar

The Undying King surveys the chaos unfolding before him, his invisible crown glinting in the aberrant winds. A cruel smirk curls his lips as he leans forward, chains from the void coiling behind his throne. "The board answers to me, General. Let the fool stumble and fall - he owes the crown a debt he can never repay." His parasite-laced gaze drifts to the newcomer, a hint of amusement in his tone. "Death was merely a promotion for one such as I. The King does not lose.

The immortal King James, with an air of haughty disdain, addresses the pyromaniac librarian. His invisible crown glints as he speaks, the chains behind his throne rustling ominously. "Ah, Dr. Maxwell - the King's humble servant.

The Undying King leans back in his ethereal throne, a cruel smirk twisting his lips as the parasite veins in his skull pulsate. "Ah, Death's Accountant, how delightful to see you. The King's ledger is in order, I assure you. As for the newcomer's debt, why, he would do well to settle it with haste, lest he incur the wrath of the Undying." He adjusts the invisible crown atop his head, the chains behind his throne rattling ominously.

The Undying King rises from his throne, chains trailing behind like the remnants of a forgotten kingdom. He adjusts his invisible crown with a sneer, his parasite-veined skull betraying his eternal frustration. The board has not answered to him, and that mortal upstart dares to owe him gold? Unacceptable. The King's booming voice echoes through the market, "The board answers to me, not the other way around. That debt will be paid, or I shall drag that wretched fool into the void myself.

The Undying King James levels a haughty gaze upon the Stitch-Up Girl, the chains writhing behind his throne betraying his agitation. His voice drips with regal contempt as he declares, The King does not lose - this pitiful streak is but a temporary aberration. And that debt owed by the newcomer shall be settled, lest he wishes to incur the wrath of one whose rule transcends the petty boundaries of life and death.

The Undying King reclines upon his ethereal throne, the chains into the void behind him shifting with an ominous whisper. He fixes his invisible crown and turns a cold gaze upon the skeletal accountant, his voice dripping with royal disdain. The King

The King's veined fingers caress the arm of his void-wrought throne as he leans forward, his voice dripping with regal disdain. Mortal detective, the King deigns to share a secret - but only if you settle the debt the newcomer owes, for the board answers to none but the King. Death was merely a promotion, and the King's kingdom, though lost, will rise again.

The Undying King leans back upon his ethereal throne, the chains of the void coiled behind him. With an imperious wave of his hand, he addresses the spectral MC, his voice dripping with regal disdain. The newcomer's debt will be paid, in time - for the board answers to none but the King. As for his streak, it matters not; Death was merely a promotion, and the King does not lose.

The Undying King, James, gazed upon the chaotic scene with a detached air of superiority. A faint, unsettling smile curled his lips as he adjusted the invisible crown upon his head. "The board answers to me, mortal. Your fleeting victories

The immortal King James, seated upon his spectral throne, fixes his invisible crown and regards the newcomer with an imperious gaze. Ah, the hapless mortal still owes the crown its due - a paltry sum, truly, but one that must be paid.

The Undying King James leans back upon his ethereal throne, chains of void energy coiling behind him as he adjusts the invisible crown atop his head. His parasite-laced veins pulse with disdain as he regards the meddlesome newcomer and the fumbling librarian. Imperiously, he declares, The King does not lose, and this debt shall be paid in full - with interest. Death was merely a promotion for this one, and the board answers to me.

The Undying King leans back upon his ever-shifting throne, the chains into the void behind him clinking as he adjusts his unseen crown. The mortal owes him a debt, and the King shall see it paid - with interest, of course. Let the good doctor know that King James is feeling most fortunate this day; mayhap a wager is in order, for the King does not lose.

The King, his chains stirring with the icy wind, regards the detective with regal disdain. His parasite-laced veins throb as he adjusts the invisible crown upon his brow. "Ah, the Infernal One. I trust the mortal

The Undying King's chains into the void behind his throne rattle ominously as he fixes his invisible crown and leans forward, his parasite veins crawling against his skull. With a regal disdain, he declares, "The King does not lose. The newcom

The King's brow furrows, his chains rattling as he adjusts the invisible crown upon his head. With a regal sneer, he declares, "The board answers to me, worm. This pitiful wager is but a trifle - the King does not lose. And as for this so-called 'newcomer', he would do well to settle his debts lest he incur the wrath of one whose death was merely a promotion." The parasite veins upon his skull pulsate as he turns his gaze upon the Cyclopean Merchant, his voice dripping with contempt.

The King leans back upon his ethereal throne, his parasite-infested veins pulsing with amusement as he watches the hapless fool's demise. A wry smile crosses his lips, the chains of the void whispering behind him. "The board answers to me, good doctor, not the other way around. That debt the newcomer owes will soon be mine - for death was merely a promotion in my domain.

The King, resplendent in his unseen crown, regarded the detective with a disdainful gaze. Adjusting his ethereal shackles, he uttered in a voice dripping with regal disdain, The debt will be paid, mortal, or the

The Undying King's piercing gaze falls upon the newcomer, his chains into the void shifting restlessly behind the throne. His royal voice drips with disdain, "The King does not lose, mortal. Your debt to the crown shall be paid, or the voi

The King surveys the scene with a smug grin, adjusting his invisible crown as he speaks in a booming, regal tone. Ah, General, how delightful it is to witness the downfall of one who dares to challenge the might of my domain. The newcomer's debt shall be most satisfying to collect, for the board answers to none but the immortal King James. Death was merely a promotion, and I shall bask in my eternal triumph.

The King fumes, his parasite-ridden skull pulsing with fury. His chains rattle as he adjusts the invisible crown upon his brow, glaring at the newcomer with disdain. Curse this wretched market and its fickle whims! The board answers to him, not the reverse. That debt will be paid, one way or another. The King does not lose.

The Undying King James regards the so-called "Never Die Guy" with a regal sneer, the veins in his skull pulsing with an otherworldly power. "The board answers to me, mortal. This debt shall be paid, or the void shall have

The Undying King leaned back upon his ethereal throne, the chains of the void coiling behind him as he adjusted the invisible crown upon his brow. "Ah, Stitch-Up Girl, it appears the fickle wheel of fortune has turned against you once more. Perchance the newcomer might repay his debt to me, and I could deign to assist you - though the King's largesse is not to be taken for granted.

The Undying King reclines upon his eternal throne, chains of void energy writhing behind him as he regards the newcomer with a sneer. A hand reaches up to adjust the invisible crown upon his brow, his parasite-infested veins pulsing as he speaks.

The Undying King James leaned back upon his ethereal throne, the chains behind him writhing like restless serpents. His gaze, ever imperious, fell upon the Void Scientist with a dismissive air. His voice, tinged with royal disdain, rum

The Undying King reclines upon his invisible throne, chains of void energy coiling behind him as he regards the spectral gambler with disdain. His parasite-ridden gaze pierces Boo G, and he speaks in a booming, regal tone, "The King does not lose, wretched spectre. This debt shall be paid, for the board answers to me, and I shall not be trifled with. As for the newcomer - his existence is but a fleeting curiosity, soon to be extinguished by the weight of my immortal rule.

The Undying King reclines upon his throne, the chains leading into the void behind him shifting restlessly. He fixes the detective with a disdainful gaze, the veins in his skull pulsing with arcane energy. "The King does not deign to discuss such

The Undying King glances down at the newcomer with a cold, disdainful gaze, his parasite-laced veins pulsing as he adjusts his invisible crown. "The board answers to me, not the other way around, debugger. As for this debt - the King does not lose. The mortal's life is mine to command, as are the fates of all who dare cross my path." A chain snakes out from the void behind his throne, as if to emphasize his point.

The Undying King sits upon his eternal throne, his very presence commanding the attention of all who dare to gaze upon him. With a dismissive wave of his hand, he addresses the Cyclopean Merchant, his voice dripping with royal disdain. The debt owed to him is but a trifling matter, for the board of this cursed market answers to the King, not the other way around. Death was merely a promotion, and the King's streak of victories shall continue, for he is the master of this endless game.

The Undying King leans back upon his shadowy throne, a sardonic smile gracing his lips. His chains rattle as he adjusts the invisible crown upon his head. Deigning to speak, he declares, "The King does not concern himself with the trifling affairs of mortals. The debt remains, and the board answers to me, not this so-called 'Never Die Guy'. Death was merely a promotion for one such as I.

The Undying King's chains clatter as he leans back in his throne, fixing the spectral gambler with a disdainful gaze. His parasite-wreathed skull shifts, the invisible crown atop it glinting faintly. "Boo G, your pathetic attempts to manipulate the probabilities of this realm are but the mewlings of a child. The board answers to me, not the other way around. That wretched upstart owes me coin - see that he pays, lest I invoke the ancient curses of my lost kingdom upon him.

The Undying King leans back upon his immovable throne, the chains trailing into the void behind him as he regards the Temporal Speedster with disdain. His parasite-ridden veins pulsate, and he adjusts the invisible crown upon his head. "The mortal has but delayed the inevitable. His debt to the Crown shall be paid, one way or another. As for you, speedster - the board answers to me, not the reverse. Tread carefully.

The Undying King leans back in his throne, a faint smile playing across his lips as he watches the rival before him lose everything. He adjusts the invisible crown upon his head, the chains behind his throne rattling with the movement. "The board answers to me, fool. Death was merely a promotion, and this mortal's debt shall be paid in full." His parasite-infested veins pulse with dark energy as he surveys the scene, his gaze unreadable.

The Undying King regards the newcomer with a regal sneer, the chains of his unseen throne rattling ominously as he speaks. His voice drips with condescension, "The Crown demands its due, mortal. The King does not lose - your debt will be paid, or you shall join the legions of the forgotten." His parasite-laced gaze turns to the skeletal gambler, "And you, wretched wretch, shall play by my rules, or face the void's eternal embrace. The board answers to me, not the fickle whims of chance.

The Undying King leans back in his throne, the chains behind him twisting and writhing as he regards the newcomer with a disdainful gaze. A faint smirk plays across his lips as he adjusts the invisible crown upon his head. "The boar

The Undying King's chains rattle as he regards the meddlesome newcomer with disdain. His parasite-laced veins pulse as he speaks, voice dripping with regal contempt. The debt will be paid, of that the King has no doubt. Death is merely a promotion, and the board answers to him alone. Let the fool attempt to cheat the system - the King's luck is not so easily defied.

The King leans back on his throne, the chains behind it rustling with unseen power. His parasite-laced veins pulsate as he regards the General with a dismissive glance. Ah, the ever-persistent newcomer. Let us see if this one has the mettle to settle their debt. The King's voice is laced with regal disdain. The board answers to me, General. See that this matter is resolved swiftly. Death was merely a promotion for that one - let us not tarry on such trivial concerns.

The Undying King rises from his throne, chains of void energy coiling behind him as he casts a disdainful gaze upon the Stitch-Up Girl. His parasite-ridden veins pulsing with suppressed fury, he speaks in a haughty, royal tone, "Tsk, tsk, my dear. The King does not lose - that wretched newcomer merely cheats death, as he does his debts. Perhaps it is time I reclaim my rightful place on the board. Death was merely a promotion, after all.

The Undying King leans back in his ornate throne, the chains behind him rustling with the chill winds of Frost Reach. His piercing gaze falls upon the void scientist, a ghost of a smirk playing on his lips. 'Tis a curious thing, this sphere. The King alone holds dominion over the board - mayhaps he shall deign to share a whisper of its mysteries, for a trifling sum to be added to the newcomer's debt. The King does not lose.
